result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Patrick Lenell Nubern

records.addlTxt: Intake Report- Marathon County Pretrial Services  - Completed 09-16-2022

Clerk: Amanda. 
Case called at 10:00 am.
Defendant appears in person. 

P.L.N. sworn and testifies. 
Court questions defendant RE: Employment/Income. 
Court appoints Attorney Michael Hughes @ $100/hr. not to exceed $800 without further order of the Court. 


Adj: 10:02 am.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
Indigency hearing on September 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 25, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Preliminary Hearing on November 23, 2022 at 10:45 am.

No contact with victim(s): C.M.H. or A.M.H. (non-waivable) or residence; Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 2 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
Clerk:  Amy. 
Called:  2:00 p.m. 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo.  Defendant appears in custody, via Zoom Video, and with Atty Natasha VanLieshout.  

Date and time set for initial appearance; VRCW.  
Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Prelim Time Limits Waived. 

BOND:  $5,000.00 signature bond.  

CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): C.M.H. or A.M.H. (non-waivable) or residence. 
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.  Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 2 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.  

IH:  9/15/22 at 9:30 a.m., Branch 5. 
PTC:  10/25/22 at 2:15 p.m. 
PH:  11/23/22 at 10:45 a.m. 

Adj:  2:04 p.m. 

Branch 4.

Clerk:  Amy. 
Called:  2:08 p.m. 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo.  Defendant appears in custody, via Zoom Video, and with Atty Krista Cannon and Atty Natasha VanLieshout.  

Date and time set for initial appearance; VRCW.  
Atty VanLieshout has not had a chance to meet with defendant; ADA Mayo has no objection but requesting Court to find probable cause.  

COURT makes findings and finds probable cause. 

COURT adjourns until 9/08/22 at 2:00 p.m. for SPD office to meet with defendant. 

Adj:  2:10 p.m.
